```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
e <- 1.6e-19
q <- signif(runif(1, 10, 99), 2) # charges (microcoulombs)
ans <- signif(q * 1e-6 /e, 2)  # number of electrons

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, method = "runif", delta = ans/10, range = c(0.01, 100) * ans, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("%.2g", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
A person scuffing their feet on a wool rug on a dry day accumulates a net charge
of $-`r q` \,\mu \mathsf{C}$. How many excess electrons did this person acquire?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
The electric charge of an electron is $1.6 \times 10^{-19} \,\mathsf{C}$. 
The number of electrons, $n_e$ is therefore

$$n_e = \frac{`r q` \times 10^{-6}}{1.6 \times 10^{-19}} = `r ans * 1e-14` \times 10^{14}$$
